last_episode_to_air.name: Robert Durst
last_episode_to_air.overview: The case of Robert Durst, found not guilty of murder in 2003, is recalled by his original jury members.

name: The Jury Speaks
overview: Reexamining some of the most high-profile and controversial cases in history through the eyes of the people who served on the original jury. Each episode delves into a new case including Michael Jackson, OJ Simpson, George Zimmerman and Robert Durst, as jurors uncover what really happened inside the courtroom.

episodes.name: O.J. Simpson
episodes.overview: The O.J. Simpson case is explored in the series premiere of this true-crime show that re-examines high-profile cases via the views of original jury members.

episodes.name: Michael Jackson
episodes.overview: A re-telling of the Michael Jackson 2005 criminal trial from the jurors' point of view, in which American recording artist Michael Jackson was tried based upon accusations of Gavin Arvizo, a 13-year-old boy Jackson had befriended.

episodes.name: George Zimmerman
episodes.overview: Exploring the trial that set off the Black Lives Matter movement when George Zimmerman was found not guilty of second-degree murder in the death of unarmed black teenager Trayvon Martin.

episodes.name: Robert Durst
episodes.overview: The case of Robert Durst, found not guilty of murder in 2003, is recalled by his original jury members.

episodes.name: Robert Blake
episodes.overview: A re-telling of the Robert Blake murder trial from the point of view of the jurors.
